intro: Pseudognaphalium sandwicensium var. sandwicensium, commonly known as the Hawaiian everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of tubular florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky areas and is adapted to the unique climate of Hawaii. It has small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. This species is of interest to botanists due to its endemic status and ecological significance in its native habitat.
